main event: Numerous witnesses reported observing a bright green fireball over New Mexico, particularly on December 12, 1948, around 9:27 PM.
interesting points: Dr. LaPaz, an expert in meteoritics, stated that the fireball did not resemble typical meteors and had a horizontal trajectory., Multiple eyewitnesses from different locations reported seeing the same event around the same time., The fireball's apparent brightness was compared to the light of Venus and had a distinctive green color., Estimates of the fireball's speed ranged from 3 to 12 miles per second depending on the observation., Significant differences noted in trajectory and sound in comparison to typical meteorites.
witness description: Eyewitnesses included civilian observers and military personnel, such as Major C. L. Phillips and members of the AEC security force.
